ds.util
Class BinaryTree

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.BinaryTree

public class BinaryTree
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains methods for the classic binary tree traversal algorithms, console and graphical tree display methods, and miscellaneous methods to build binary trees.

Constructor Detail

BinaryTree

public BinaryTree()
Method Detail

buildTree

public static TNode<java.lang.Character> buildTree(int n)
Builds three different binary trees with Character data and returns the root; the integer argument n in the range 0 to 2 designates the tree.

Parameters:
n - the choice of Tree0, Tree1, or Tree2.
Returns:
the root of the specified tree.

buildTime24Tree

public static TNode<Time24> buildTime24Tree()
Builds a 9-node binary trees with Time24 data and returns the root.

Returns:
the root of the tree.

preorderDisplay

public static java.lang.String preorderDisplay(TNode<?> t)
Returns a string that displays the elements in the binary tree using the preorder (NLR) scan. The description is a listing of elements separated by two blanks.

Parameters:
t - a TNode that designates the root of the tree.
Returns:
string that contains the list of elements in the array.

inorderDisplay

public static java.lang.String inorderDisplay(TNode<?> t)
Returns a string that displays the elements in the binary tree using the inorder (LNR) scan. The description is a listing of elements separated by two blanks.

Parameters:
t - a TNode that designates the root of the tree.
Returns:
string that contains the list of elements in the array.

postorderDisplay

public static java.lang.String postorderDisplay(TNode<?> t)
Returns a string that displays the elements in the binary tree using the postorder (LRN) scan. The description is a listing of elements separated by two blanks.

Parameters:
t - a TNode that designates the root of the tree.
Returns:
string that contains the list of elements in the array.

levelorderDisplay

public static <T> java.lang.String levelorderDisplay(TNode<T> t)
Returns a string that displays the elements in the binary tree using the level order scan of the nodes. The description is a listing of elements separated by two blanks.

Parameters:
t - a TNode that designates the root of the tree.
Returns:
string that contains the list of elements in the array.

the heigth of the tree.

buildExpTree

public static TNode<java.lang.Character> buildExpTree(java.lang.String postfixExp)
Builds binary expression tree that corresponds to operators and operands in a postfix expression.

Parameters:
postfixExp - a string specifying a postfix expression.
Returns:
the root of the tree.

fullParen

public static <T> java.lang.String fullParen(TNode<java.lang.Character> t)
Traverses an expression tree and returns a string that displays the equivalent fully parenthesized expression.

Parameters:
t - a TNode that designates the root of the expression tree.
Returns:
a string that displays the equivalent fully parenthesized expression.

displayTree

public static <T> java.lang.String displayTree(TNode<T> t,
                                               int maxCharacters)
Returns a string that gives a level-order display of a binary tree; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values.

Parameters:
t - a TNode that designates the root of the tree.
maxCharacters - an upper bound on the string length of the node values..
Returns:
string that gives a level-order display of a binary tree.

drawTree

public static <T> void drawTree(TNode<T> t,

Displays a single binary tree in a graphical window and then disposes of the window; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values.

Parameters:
t - a TNode that designates the root of the tree.
maxCharacters - an upper bound on the string length of the node values..

drawTrees

public static <T> void drawTrees(TNode<T> t,
                                 int maxCharacters)
Displays a binary tree in a graphical window but keeps active the window for a new frame the becomes available after pressing the ENTER key; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values.

Parameters:
t - a TNode that designates the root of the tree.
maxCharacters - an upper bound on the string length of the node values..
